channel.title: Your rights are on trial
channel.description:
Discussions and dramatizations of recent high court decisions. Features Professors of Law Monrad Paulsen of Columbia University and Charles Alan Wright of University of Texas.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Civilian court trial
item.description: "The Case of the Korean Killing" analyzes Toth v. Quarles, the case of a veteran fighting for the right to a trial in civilian court, despite the alleged crime occurring while he was still in the military overseas.
item.dc:creator: KUOM (Radio station : Minneapolis, Minn.)
item.dc:subject: War & Civil Defense

item.title: Right to Definite Charge
item.description: This program focuses on the concept of a "right to definite charge."
item.dc:creator: KUOM (Radio station : Minneapolis, Minn.)
item.dc:subject: U.S. Politics

item.title: Reasonable Interrogation
item.description: This program features William I. Siegel, assistant district attorney of Brooklyn, talking about "The Case of the Psychiatrist's Questions" and issues of interrogation.

item.dc:subject: Statutes and codes

item.title: Wiretapping
item.description: This program, "The Case of the Wireless Wiretap," focuses on wiretapping and issues of privacy. It features attorney Gilbert Rosenthal; Patrick Murphy Malin, executive director of the American Civil Liberties Union; and Federal judge Jerome Frank.
item.dc:creator: KUOM (Radio station : Minneapolis, Minn.)
item.dc:subject: Wiretapping--United States

item.title: Right to impartial jury
item.description: This program, which focuses on the case "Eugene Dennis versus the United States," discusses the right to an impartial jury.

item.dc:subject: U.S. Politics

item.title: Right to face accusers
item.description: This program focuses on the right to face one's accusers. Guest is Alan Barth, author of "The Loyalty of Free Men" and "The Case of Dr. Peters' Loyalty."

item.dc:subject: Witnesses

item.title: Due process of law
item.description: This program focuses on the concept of due process of law and includes Supreme Court Justice William O. Douglas and Federal Judge Jerome Frank.

item.title: Right to Fair Bail
item.description: This program, "The Case of the Communists' Bail," focuses on the concept of fair bail and includes Congressman Howard Smith, author of the Smith Act.

item.title: Legal search and seizure
item.description: This program discusses the parameters of legal search and seizure. The guest speaker is General Telford Taylor, Chief Counsel for the U.S. at the Nuremburg Trials.

item.title: Fair Trial Versus Free Press
item.description: This program, "The Case of the Baltimore Radio Show," analyzes the balance between fair trials and the free press. Guests are Harrison L. Winter, attorney for State of Maryland; and Elisha Hanson.
